titles.ar: بَابُ اسْتِلَامِ الْحَجَرِ بَعْدَ الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ وَ شُرْبِ مَاءِ زَمْزَمَ قَبْلَ الْخُرُوجِ إِلَى الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 140 – Touching the (Black) Stone after (Praying) the two Cycles, and drinking the water of Zamzam before going out to Al Safa and Al Marwa

titles.ar: بَابُ الْوُقُوفِ عَلَى الصَّفَا وَ الدُّعَاءِ
titles.en: Chapter 141 – The pausing upon Al Safa and the supplication

titles.ar: بَابُ اسْتِلَامِ الْحَجَرِ بَعْدَ الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ وَ شُرْبِ مَاءِ زَمْزَمَ قَبْلَ الْخُرُوجِ إِلَى الصَّفَا وَ الْمَرْوَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 140 – Touching the (Black) Stone after (Praying) the two Cycles, and drinking the water of Zamzam before going out to Al Safa and Al Marwa

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن كالصحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (18/64)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى وَ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ مُعَاوِيَةَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا فَرَغْتَ مِنَ الرَّكْعَتَيْنِ فَائْتِ الْحَجَرَ الْأَسْوَدَ وَ قَبِّلْهُ وَ اسْتَلِمْهُ أَوْ أَشِرْ إِلَيْهِ فَإِنَّهُ لَا بُدَّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ

وَ قَالَ إِنْ قَدَرْتَ أَنْ تَشْرَبَ مِنْ مَاءِ زَمْزَمَ قَبْلَ أَنْ تَخْرُجَ إِلَى الصَّفَا فَافْعَلْ وَ تَقُولُ حِينَ تَشْرَبُ اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ عِلْماً نَافِعاً وَ رِزْقاً وَاسِعاً وَ شِفَاءً مِنْ كُلِّ دَاءٍ وَ سُقْمٍ
قَالَ وَ بَلَغَنَا أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَالَ حِينَ نَظَرَ إِلَى زَمْزَمَ لَوْ لَا أَنِّي أَشُقُّ عَلَى أُمَّتِي لَأَخَذْتُ مِنْهُ ذَنُوباً أَوْ ذَنُوبَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al Fazl Bin Shazaan, from Safwan Bin Yahya and Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Muawiya Bin Ammar,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When you are free from (Praying) the two Cycles, so go to the Black Stone and kiss it, and touch it, or gesture towards it, for it is a must from that’.
And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If are able to drink from the water of Zamzam before you go out to Al-Safa, then do so, and you should be saying when you drink:
اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ عِلْماً نَافِعاً وَ رِزْقاً وَاسِعاً وَ شِفَاءً مِنْ كُلِّ دَاءٍ وَ سُقْمٍ
‘O Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Make it to be a beneficial knowledge, and an extended sustenance, and a healing from every illness and disease’.

He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘And it has reached us that Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said when he<sup>saww</sup> looked at Zamzam: ‘Had it not been difficult upon my<sup>saww</sup> community, I<sup>saww</sup> would have taken from it, a bucket or two buckets (thereby creating a Sunnah)’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr and Muhammad ibn Isma‘il from al-Fadl ibn Shadhan from Safwan ibn Yahya and ibn abu ‘Umayr from Mu‘awiyah ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that after performing two Rak‘at salat (prayer) you should go to the Black Stone, kiss, touch it and point toward it; it should be done.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘If you can drink from Zamzam before leaving for al-Safa’, it is better, and when drinking say, ‘O Allah, make it useful knowledge, abundant sustenance and a cure for all illnesses and deficiencies.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It has come to us that the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, when looking at Zamzam, said, ‘Were I not to cause difficulties for my followers, I would have taken one or two containers full of water of Zamzam.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/64)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا فَرَغَ الرَّجُلُ مِنْ طَوَافِهِ وَ صَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ فَلْيَأْتِ زَمْزَمَ وَ لْيَسْتَقِ مِنْهُ ذَنُوباً أَوْ ذَنُوبَيْنِ وَ لْيَشْرَبْ مِنْهُ وَ لِيَصُبَّ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَ ظَهْرِهِ وَ بَطْنِهِ وَ يَقُولُ اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ عِلْماً نَافِعاً وَ رِزْقاً وَاسِعاً وَ شِفَاءً مِنْ كُلِّ دَاءٍ وَ سُقْمٍ.
‘اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْهُ عِلْماً نَافِعاً وَ رِزْقاً وَاسِعاً وَ شِفَاءً مِنْ كُلِّ دَاءٍ وَ سُقْمٍ’

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘When the man is free from his Tawaaf, and he has Prayed two Cycles, so let him go to Zamzam and let him draw from it, a bucket or two buckets, and let him drink from it, and let him pour it upon his head, and his back, and his belly, and he should be saying,
‘O Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Make to be to a beneficial knowledge, and an extensive sustenance, and a healing from every illness and disease.
Then he should return to the Black Stone’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hammad from al-Halabiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that when a man completes Tawaf and the two Rak‘at salat (prayer), he should go to Zamzam. He should take one or two containers full of water, drink, pour on his head, back and belly and say, ‘O Allah, make it useful knowledge, abundant sustenance and a cure for all illnesses and deficiencies,’ and then go back to the Black Stone.’”

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَهْزِيَارَ قَالَ

text: رَأَيْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ الثَّانِيَ ( عليه السلام ) لَيْلَةَ الزِّيَارَةِ طَافَ طَوَافَ النِّسَاءِ وَ صَلَّى خَلْفَ الْمَقَامِ ثُمَّ دَخَلَ زَمْزَمَ فَاسْتَقَى مِنْهَا بِيَدِهِ بِالدَّلْوِ الَّذِي يَلِي الْحَجَرَ وَ شَرِبَ مِنْهُ وَ صَبَّ عَلَى بَعْضِ جَسَدِهِ ثُمَّ اطَّلَعَ فِي زَمْزَمَ مَرَّتَيْنِ
وَ أَخْبَرَنِي بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا أَنَّهُ رَآهُ بَعْدَ ذَلِكَ بِسَنَةٍ فَعَلَ مِثْلَ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Mahziyar who said,

‘I saw Abu Ja’farasws the ‘الثَّانِيَ’ (the 2nd) on the night of the visitation (of the Kaaba), performing a Tawaaf, being the Tawaaf of the women (طَوَافَ النِّسَاءِ), and heasws Prayed behind the Standing Place (of Ibrahimas), then heasws entered Zazam. So he withdrew from it by his hand, with a bucket, near to the (Black) Stone, and drank from it, and poured upon parts of his body. Then heasws looked into Zamzam twice’.
And one of our companions informed me that he saw him<sup>asws</sup> after that, a year later, doing similar to that’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn Mahziyar from who has said the following: “I once saw abu Ja‘far, the 2nd, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, in the night of Ziyarat perform Tawaf al-Nisa’. He (the Imam) performed Salat (prayer) behind Maqam (station) of Ibrahim ‘Alayhi al-Salam, then went in Zamzam, took water with his hand with the bucket which is next to al-Hajar, drank from it and poured on certain parts of his body. He (the Imam) then looked into Zamzam twice. Certain persons of our people have narrated to me that they had seen him next year doing the same way.” (Fatwa best explains the rest of the above Chapter)
